/**
 * Book ç±»ï¼Œä»£è¡¨ä¸€ä¸ªä¹¦æœ¬.
 * @constructor
 * @param {string} title - ä¹¦æœ¬çš„æ ‡é¢˜.
 * @param {string} author - ä¹¦æœ¬çš„ä½œè€….
 */
function Book(title, author) {
  this.title = title
  this.author = author
}

Book.prototype = {
  /**
   * è·å–ä¹¦æœ¬çš„æ ‡é¢˜
   * @returns {string|*}
   */
  getTitle() {
    return this.title
  },
  /**
   * è®¾ç½®ä¹¦æœ¬çš„é¡µæ•°
   * @param pageNum {number} é¡µæ•°
   */
  setPageNum(pageNum) {
    this.pageNum = pageNum
  }
}

const book = new Book('æŸ³æ—é£å£°', 'è‚¯å°¼æ–¯Â·æ ¼é›·å„å§†')
console.log(book.getTitle())

vscode ç»“åˆ Document this æ’ä»¶é£Ÿç”¨æœ€ä½³ï¼Œå¯ä»¥è‡ªåŠ¨ç”Ÿæˆä¸€äº›åŸºäº JSDoc è§„èŒƒçš„æ³¨é‡Š

å‘½ä»¤è¡Œå‚æ•°

jsdoc å‘½ä»¤æ”¯æŒå¾ˆå¤šå‚æ•°ï¼Œå…·ä½“å¯ä»¥å‚è€ƒè¿™é‡Œ:

å‚æ•° æè¿°
-a , --access Only display symbols with the given access property: private, protected, public, or undefined, or all for all access levels. By default, all except private symbols are shown.
-c , --configure The path to a JSDoc configuration file. Defaults to conf.json or conf.json.EXAMPLE in the directory where JSDoc is installed.
-d , --destination The path to the output folder for the generated documentation. For JSDocâ€™s built-in Haruki template, use console to dump data to the console. Defaults to ./out.
â€“debug Log information that can help debug issues in JSDoc itself.
-e , --encoding Assume this encoding when reading all source files. Defaults to utf8.
-h, â€“help Display information about JSDocâ€™s command-line options, then exit.
â€“match Only run tests whose names contain value.
â€“nocolor When running tests, do not use color in the console output. On Windows, this option is enabled by default.
-p, â€“private Include symbols marked with the @private tag in the generated documentation. By default, private symbols are not included.
-P, â€“package The package.json file that contains the project name, version, and other details. Defaults to the first package.json file found in the source paths.
â€“pedantic Treat errors as fatal errors, and treat warnings as errors. Defaults to false.
-q , --query A query string to parse and store in the global variable env.opts.query. Example: foo=bar&baz=true.
-r, â€“recurse Recurse into subdirectories when scanning for source files and tutorials.
-R, â€“readme The README.md file to include in the generated documentation. Defaults to the first README.md file found in the source paths.
-t , --template The path to the template to use for generating output. Defaults to templates/default, JSDocâ€™s built-in default template.
-T, â€“test Run JSDocâ€™s test suite, and print the results to the console.
-u , --tutorials Directory in which JSDoc should search for tutorials. If omitted, no tutorial pages will be generated. See the tutorial instructions for more information.
-v, â€“version Displays JSDocâ€™s version number, then exits.
â€“verbose Log detailed information to the console as JSDoc runs. Defaults to false.
-X, â€“explain Dump all doclets to the console in JSON format, then exit.

source

jsdoc é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶æœ‰ä»¥ä¸‹æ¯”è¾ƒé‡è¦çš„å‡ ä¸ªå‚æ•°ï¼š

  • source.include - å¯é€‰è·¯å¾„æ•°ç»„ï¼Œåº”è¯¥åŒ…å«çš„
  • source.exclude - å¯é€‰è·¯å¾„æ•°ç»„ï¼Œåº”è¯¥å¿½ç•¥çš„
  • source.includePattern - å¯é€‰æ­£åˆ™è¡¨è¾¾å¼ï¼Œæ‰€æœ‰æ–‡ä»¶å¿…é¡»åŒ¹é…ï¼ŒJSDoc è¿›è¡Œæ‰«æ
  • source.excludePattern - ä»»ä½•åŒ¹é…è¯¥æ­£åˆ™è¡¨è¾¾å¼çš„æ–‡ä»¶éƒ½è¢«å¿½ç•¥
{
  "source": {
    "include": ["./a.js", "./lib", "./_private"],
    "exclude": ["./lib/ignore.js"],
    "includePattern": ".+\\.js?$",
    "excludePattern": "(^|\\/|\\\\)_"
  }
}

é…ç½®é¡¹è¿˜æ”¯æŒ templatesã€plugins ç­‰ã€‚è¯¦ç»†çš„è¯·çœ‹æ–‡æ¡£è¿™é‡Œ ğŸ‘ˆ

{
  "plugins": [], // No plugins are loaded
  "recurseDepth": 10, // æ­é… -r å‚æ•°ä½¿ç”¨ï¼ŒJSDoc will search for files 10 levels deep
  "source": {
    "includePattern": ".+\\.js(doc|x)?$", // Only files ending in .js, .jsdoc, and .jsx will be processed
    "excludePattern": "(^|\\/|\\\\)_" // Any file starting with an underscore, or in a directory starting with an underscore, will be ignored
  },
  "sourceType": "module", // JSDoc supports code that uses ES2015 modules
  "tags": {
    "allowUnknownTags": true, // JSDoc allows you to use unrecognized tags
    "dictionaries": ["jsdoc", "closure"] // Both standard JSDoc tags and Closure Compiler tags are enabled
  },
  "templates": { // Inline {@link} tags are rendered in plain text
    "cleverLinks": false,
    "monospaceLinks": false
  }
}

 * A quite wonderful function.
